episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a range of fascinating topics, including the incredible olfactory abilities of elephants, Thomas Jefferson's unique approach to the Bible, the history of caviar as a bar snack in 19th century America, and the legendary size and drinking habits of wrestling star Andre the Giant.

facts.fact: Elephants can tell how much of something is in a closed bucket by smell alone.
Thomas Jefferson cut his Bible to pieces and glued it back together in the order he thought it should be written.
In 19th century America, caviar was a free bar snack.
Wrestling star Andre the Giant was so massive that once when he drunkenly passed out in a hotel lobby, staff couldn't move him and had to corner him off with velvet ropes until he woke up.
